meanings.definition: A substance used to disperse or scatter particles in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The dispersant helped break up the oil spill in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The scientist added the dispersant to the solution to evenly spread the particles.
meanings.sent3: The dispersant was like a magical potion that made the liquid sparkle.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a dispersant, spreading joy among the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The dispersant worked like a tiny tornado, swirling the particles around.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that disperses something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was a dispersant of knowledge, spreading it to all students.
meanings.sent2: The wind acted as a dispersant, carrying the seeds far away.
meanings.sent3: The little girl was a dispersant of happiness, making everyone around her smile.
meanings.sent4: His presence in the room was a dispersant, breaking the tension instantly.
meanings.sent5: The dispersant of rumors in the office was always the gossiping secretary.
